channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: India and China Reach Border Deal That Could Ease Hostilities
item.description: Four years ago, several soldiers from both sides were killed in a bloody melee. Any thaw between the countries could have global implications.

item.title: Hamas’s Guerrilla Tactics in North Gaza Make It Hard to Defeat
item.description: Israel has decimated Hamas’s military wing, along with much of Gaza. But the group’s small-scale, hit-and-run approach poses a threat in the enclave’s...

item.title: Meet Tim Cook, Nike consigliere
item.description: Just do it. And by "it," we mean "pick a new CEO."

item.title: The Healthy and Unhealthy Ways to Digest Polls in the Final Two Weeks
item.description: The presidential race is close. For now, we have to live with that.

item.title: Former Humana CEO Bruce Broussard joins Define Ventures as venture partner
item.description: Former Humana CEO and president Bruce Broussard will be joining VC firm Define Ventures as a venture partner, Fortune can exclusively report.

item.title: Voter Fraud Isn’t As Bad As You Think
item.description: Widespread cheating at the polls is a myth. So what are election deniers really after?

item.title: Hyundai Motor India shares drop in debut after country’s biggest ever IPO

item.title: Ireland threatens to fine Facebook and TikTok if they don’t end ‘Wild West’ of harmful content
item.description: Social media firms breaching the rules face fines of up to €20 million or 10% of their annual turnover.

item.title: Over 20 world leaders head to Russia for BRICS summit as Putin tries to rival west
item.description: President Vladimir Putin is seeking to show Western attempts to isolate Moscow over the two-and-a-half-year offensive have failed.
